gaslighting.name: Gaslighting Detector

Reality Denial.response: I know what happened. I was there.

Memory Attack.description: Attacking your memory to create doubt
Memory Attack.response: My memory is fine. I remember this clearly.

Perception Invalidation.response: My perception is valid. I experienced what I experienced.

Emotion Dismissal.description: Telling you how to feel about your experience
Emotion Dismissal.response: I decide how I feel about things that happen to me.

Rewriting History.description: Changing the narrative after the fact
Rewriting History.response: I understood exactly what you said.

Blame Reversal.description: Making you responsible for their actions
Blame Reversal.response: You are responsible for your own actions.

Isolation Attempt.description: Making you feel alone in your perception
Isolation Attempt.response: Others' opinions don't change my experience.

Sanity Questioning.response: I'm perfectly capable of assessing my own mental state.

reality_checks: Your experience is real - you lived it
Confusion after conversations is a red flag
Document incidents in writing
Repeated gaslighting is emotional abuse
Trust your gut - if something feels wrong, it is
Talk to someone you trust about these incidents

love_bombing.name: Love Bombing Detector
love_bombing.description: Detect excessive early affection used for manipulation

Intensity Spike.response: Real connection develops gradually, not instantly.

Future Faking.response: Let's focus on getting to know each other first.

Constant Contact.response: I need space to maintain my own life.

Gift Bombardment.response: I appreciate thoughtfulness, not overwhelming gestures.

reality_checks: Healthy relationships develop slowly over time
Love bombing is about control, not affection
Notice if intensity drops after you commit
Real love allows you to maintain independence

guilt_trip.name: Guilt Trip Detector

After Everything I've Done.description: Using past favors to create obligation
After Everything I've Done.response: I appreciate what you've done, but that doesn't obligate me to this specific thing

Comparison Shame.description: Comparing you unfavorably to create shame
Comparison Shame.response: I make decisions based on what's right for me, not comparisons

Disappointment Play.response: Your disappointment is about your expectations, not my choices

Hurt Display.response: I'm sorry you're hurt, but I'm not responsible for your feelings about my boundaries

Suffering Emphasis.response: I care about your wellbeing, but I can't always be the solution

Abandonment Frame.response: Setting boundaries isn't abandonment - it's healthy

Martyrdom.description: Playing the martyr to induce guilt
Martyrdom.response: I hear you'll manage - I trust you

Silent Treatment Preview.response: That's your choice. I'm still here if you want to talk respectfully

severity_levels.label: NO GUILT TRIPS DETECTED
severity_levels.desc: No obvious guilt manipulation patterns found

reality_checks: You are not responsible for others' feelings about your boundaries
Past favors don't create unlimited future obligations
Healthy relationships respect 'no'
Guilt is a signal to check if YOU did something wrong, not automatic compliance

future_faking.name: Future Faking Detector
future_faking.description: Detect false promises about the future

Grand Future Plans.description: Creating elaborate future scenarios too early
Grand Future Plans.response: Let's focus on the present and build trust gradually

Timeline Pushing.response: These are important decisions that need time and real foundation

Perfect Life Painting.response: Real relationships have challenges - this sounds too idealized

Conditional Promises.description: Making promises contingent on your compliance
Conditional Promises.response: I need to see consistent actions now, not conditional future promises

severity_levels.label: REALISTIC DISCUSSION
severity_levels.desc: Future talk seems grounded and gradual

severity_levels.label: FUTURE FAKING SIGNS
severity_levels.desc: pattern(s) - may be moving too fast

reality_checks: Actions in the present matter more than promises about the future
Healthy relationships build gradually, not through grand future visions
If they're perfect in fantasy but problematic now, believe the now
Future faking is a control tactic to keep you invested

hoovering.name: Hoovering Detector
hoovering.description: Detect attempts to suck you back into toxic relationship

Sudden Reappearance.description: Reappearing out of nowhere with emotional hooks
Sudden Reappearance.response: Actions over time matter more than sudden emotional appeals

Crisis Hook.description: Creating crisis to pull you back in
Crisis Hook.response: If it's a real crisis, there are other resources available

Changed Person Claim.response: Real change takes time and shows in consistent actions, not words

Good Times Nostalgia.description: Romanticizing past to erase bad memories
Good Times Nostalgia.response: Selective memory - the bad times were real too

Breadcrumbs.response: These aren't real connection attempts, they're hooks

severity_levels.label: STRONG HOOVERING
severity_levels.desc: patterns - manipulation to pull you back

reality_checks: People rarely change without significant time and effort
If they were toxic before, a few weeks won't fix that
Hoovering intensifies when they lose control
Maintain your boundaries - you left for good reasons

emotional_blackmail.name: Emotional Blackmail Detector
emotional_blackmail.description: Identify FOG: Fear, Obligation, Guilt manipulation

Threats.description: Direct or implied threats of negative consequences
Threats.response: Threats are not acceptable - this is emotional abuse

Self-Harm Threats.description: Threatening self-harm to control you - call 988 if serious
Self-Harm Threats.response: If serious, call 988. Their mental health is not your responsibility to manage alone

Duty Appeals.description: Appealing to obligation to override your choice
Duty Appeals.response: I decide my own obligations based on what's right for me

Shame Induction.description: Making you feel defective for having boundaries
Shame Induction.response: Having boundaries doesn't make me a bad person

Historical Debt.description: Citing past actions to create current debt
Historical Debt.response: Past kindness doesn't create unlimited future obligations

Victim Playing.description: Positioning themselves as victim of your boundaries
Victim Playing.response: I can see you're upset, but my boundary stands

Silent Treatment.response: I'm here when you want to communicate respectfully

Love Withdrawal.response: Real love doesn't require me to violate my boundaries

severity_levels.label: EMOTIONAL BLACKMAIL
severity_levels.desc: Multiple tactics to control through FOG

reality_checks: Your 'no' is a complete sentence
You can care about someone AND have boundaries
Their emotions are not your emergency
This is abuse - consider professional support if severe

triangulation.name: Triangulation Detector
triangulation.description: Identify when a third party is used to manipulate

Comparison to Ex.description: Using past relationships to create competition/insecurity
Comparison to Ex.response: I'm not interested in comparisons - let's discuss us

Third Party Agreement.description: Claiming others agree to strengthen their position
Third Party Agreement.response: I'd like to hear their opinion directly

Secret Information.response: I'll talk to them directly if there's an issue

Jealousy Induction.description: Mentioning others' interest to provoke jealousy
Jealousy Induction.response: I trust you - this information doesn't change that

Flying Monkeys.description: Recruiting others to their cause against you
Flying Monkeys.response: I'll get the full story directly from the source

Comparison Shame.description: Using others to make you feel inadequate
Comparison Shame.response: I don't need to prove myself against anyone

Messenger Manipulation.description: Using you as messenger to another person
Messenger Manipulation.response: You can communicate with them directly

severity_levels.label: TRIANGULATION DETECTED
severity_levels.desc: Multiple tactics to involve third parties

reality_checks: Healthy communication is direct, not through third parties
If they wanted to resolve it, they'd talk to YOU
You don't need to prove yourself against anyone
Triangulation creates chaos - that's the goal

projection.name: Projection Detector
projection.description: Identify when someone accuses you of their behavior

Accusation of Their Behavior.description: Accusing you of exactly what they do
Accusation of Their Behavior.response: Let's look at the facts - who actually does this?

Sudden Character Attack.description: Labels that come from nowhere and describe them
Sudden Character Attack.response: Where is this coming from? This doesn't match my actions

Preemptive Defense.description: Defending against accusations you didn't make
Preemptive Defense.response: I didn't accuse you of that - why bring it up?

DARVO Pattern.description: Deny, Attack, Reverse Victim and Offender
DARVO Pattern.response: Let's stay on the original topic - what actually happened

Excessive Suspicion.description: Extreme suspicion often reveals their own behavior
Excessive Suspicion.response: This level of suspicion says more about you than me

Jealousy Accusation.description: Accusing you of jealousy they actually feel
Jealousy Accusation.response: I'm not jealous - I'm responding to your behavior

reality_checks: You don't have to defend against false accusations
Redirect: 'Let's stay on the original topic'
Their perception of you says more about them
Projection is a defense mechanism - they can't face their own behavior
Document incidents - patterns become clear over time

breadcrumbing.name: Breadcrumbing Detector
breadcrumbing.description: Identify minimal effort designed to keep you interested

Non-Committal Messages.description: Messages that are short and don't advance connection

Social Media Only.description: Engaging online but not making real plans

Plan Cancellation.description: Repeatedly cancelling or avoiding concrete plans
Plan Cancellation.response: Actions show priority - words are just noise

Reappearance Cycles.description: Disappearing then returning when you start moving on
Reappearance Cycles.response: This is manipulation, not genuine interest

Surface Level Only.response: Someone who wants you will want to know you

Always You Initiating.description: You're always the one making effort
Always You Initiating.response: Stop initiating - see if they make effort

severity_levels.label: SIGNIFICANT BREADCRUMBING
severity_levels.desc: You're being kept on the hook

reality_checks: If they wanted to, they would
Inconsistent availability = inconsistent interest
You deserve consistent effort, not crumbs
Your peace > their occasional attention

intermittent_reinforcement.name: Intermittent Reinforcement Detector
intermittent_reinforcement.description: Identify the pattern that creates addiction to relationships

Unpredictable Affection.description: Their affection and attention is unpredictable
Unpredictable Affection.response: Healthy love is consistent, not a guessing game

Intense Highs.description: Good moments feel incredibly intense and valuable

Obsessive Analysis.description: You obsessively analyze their behavior for patterns
Obsessive Analysis.response: You shouldn't have to decode someone who loves you

Anxiety Cycles.description: You feel anxious between positive interactions
Anxiety Cycles.response: Love should bring peace, not constant anxiety

Can't Leave.description: You can't leave despite the pain
Can't Leave.response: This is addiction, not love - seek support

Trying Harder.description: You keep trying harder hoping to unlock consistent treatment
Trying Harder.response: You can't earn what should be freely given

Roller Coaster.description: The relationship feels like an emotional roller coaster
Roller Coaster.response: Healthy relationships have stability, not chaos

reality_checks: Intensity is not intimacy
Chaos is not chemistry
You can't earn consistent love - it's given freely
This pattern creates trauma bonds, not healthy attachment
You deserve stable, predictable love

scapegoating.name: Scapegoating Detector
scapegoating.description: Identify when you're being blamed for group problems

Blamed for Others.description: Blamed for problems you didn't cause
Blamed for Others.response: I'm not responsible for everyone else's issues

Double Standards.description: Held to different standards than others
Double Standards.response: I notice I'm being held to different standards

Success Minimized.description: Your successes are ignored or minimized
Success Minimized.response: My accomplishments are valid regardless of your response

Mistakes Amplified.description: Your mistakes are amplified and remembered
Mistakes Amplified.response: Everyone makes mistakes - this selective memory is unfair

Behavior Excused for Others.description: Others' bad behavior is excused but yours isn't
Behavior Excused for Others.response: I notice there are different rules for different people

Excluded.description: You're excluded from information or opportunities
Excluded.response: This pattern of exclusion is deliberate

Negative Intent Assumed.description: Your intentions are assumed to be negative
Negative Intent Assumed.response: You're assigning intent that wasn't there

Bonding Through Criticism.description: Others bond by talking negatively about you
Bonding Through Criticism.response: People who need a common enemy are not healthy

severity_levels.label: MODERATE SCAPEGOATING
severity_levels.desc: Pattern emerging - document and protect yourself

severity_levels.label: SIGNIFICANT SCAPEGOATING
severity_levels.desc: You're being used as the designated problem

reality_checks: Scapegoating serves the group, not truth
You were assigned a role - it's not your identity
No amount of good behavior will change their perception
Some systems are healthier to leave than to fix
Your worth is not determined by how this group treats you

moving_goalposts.name: Moving Goalposts Detector
moving_goalposts.description: Identify when success criteria keeps changing

Requirements Changed.description: Requirements changed after you met the original ones
Requirements Changed.response: I met the original agreement. That's complete.

Not Enough Anymore.description: What was 'enough' before is suddenly not enough
Not Enough Anymore.response: This was acceptable before - why the change now?

Yes But Pattern.description: Always something else needed after accomplishment
Yes But Pattern.response: I notice there's always a 'but' - what would actually satisfy you?

Moving Target.description: The target keeps getting further away
Moving Target.response: The target keeps moving - that's not a fair measure of success

Never Quite Right.description: No matter what you do, it's never quite right
Never Quite Right.response: This pattern of 'almost' suggests the goal isn't achievable

Retroactive Changes.response: That wasn't part of the original agreement

Success Redefined.description: Success gets redefined right as you achieve it
Success Redefined.response: You're changing the definition after I met it

severity_levels.label: SIGNIFICANT GOALPOST MOVING
severity_levels.desc: You're being set up to always fail

reality_checks: If the goal keeps moving, you're not meant to reach it
This is about control, not standards
You can't win a rigged game
Your worth isn't defined by their impossible standards

victim_blaming.name: Victim Blaming Detector
victim_blaming.description: Identify when responsibility is wrongly shifted

Why Didn't You.description: Questioning your actions instead of the wrongdoer's
Why Didn't You.response: The focus should be on their harmful action, not my response

Provocation Claim.description: Claiming your behavior caused their harmful action
Provocation Claim.response: Nothing I did justifies that response

Hindsight Blame.response: Hindsight doesn't make me responsible for their choice

Responsibility Shift.response: Their choice to act that way was THEIR choice

Character Attack.response: My character is not the issue - their behavior is

Minimization.description: Dismissing impact to reduce wrongdoer's responsibility

Look What You Made Me Do.response: I did not make you do anything - you chose your behavior

reality_checks: Harmful behavior is the responsibility of the person who did it
No one 'makes' someone else hurt them
You don't have to accept misplaced blame
Your reaction to harm doesn't cause the harm

news_bias.name: News Bias Detector
news_bias.description: Identify bias and manipulation in news articles

Loaded Language.description: Emotionally charged words to influence reader reaction
Loaded Language.response: Notice the emotional language - what are the actual facts?

One-Sided Sources.description: Vague attribution without naming specific sources
One-Sided Sources.response: Who exactly are these sources? Why aren't they named?

Sensationalism.response: Is this actually unprecedented, or just attention-seeking language?

Omission Signals.description: Vague claims without evidence or specifics
Omission Signals.response: Who specifically says this? What's the actual evidence?

Attack Framing.description: Combat language frames everything as conflict
Attack Framing.response: Is this actually a conflict, or just disagreement being dramatized?

Fear Appeals.description: Fear-based language to drive emotional response
Fear Appeals.response: What's the actual risk level without the fear language?

Headline Bait.description: Clickbait patterns designed to manipulate clicks
Headline Bait.response: Clickbait signals - check if headline matches content

Political Framing.description: Political labels that may oversimplify positions
Political Framing.response: Labels oversimplify - what are the actual positions?

media_literacy_tips: Read multiple sources on the same topic
Notice your emotional reaction - that's often the goal
Ask: 'What am I not being told?'
Check if headline matches article content

turn.name: 15¬∞ Turn Detector
turn.description: Find where the real message is hidden after the pivot

But.description: Negates everything before it - the real message comes after
But.response: Notice the 'but' - everything before it was performative

Actually.description: Correction incoming - previous statement being revised
Actually.response: The 'actually' signals the real point is coming

Honestly.description: Implies previous statements were incomplete or misleading
Honestly.response: If they need to say 'honestly', what was the rest?

That Said.description: Exception or contradiction about to follow
That Said.response: The exception they're about to make is their real position

Nevertheless.description: Dismissing or overriding the previous point
Nevertheless.response: They're now overriding what they just acknowledged

Yet.response: The 'yet' reveals they don't actually agree with the setup

Still.response: Despite their acknowledgment, they're still disagreeing

Except.response: The exception is what they really mean

turn_examples.text: I love your idea, but I don't think it will work
You're smart, however this approach is wrong
turn_examples.real_message: Your approach is wrong (compliment was setup)

turn_examples.text: I hear you, although I disagree

pressure.name: Pressure Detector
pressure.description: Identify pressure tactics in messages and sales pitches

Time Pressure.description: Artificial urgency to bypass rational decision-making
Time Pressure.response: Genuine opportunities rarely have artificial deadlines. I'll decide on my timeline.

Scarcity.description: Manufacturing scarcity to create panic buying
Scarcity.response: If it's truly scarce, I can find it elsewhere or do without it.

Social Proof Pressure.description: Using others' behavior to pressure your decision
Social Proof Pressure.response: What others do is irrelevant to my specific situation.

Authority Pressure.description: Invoking authority to bypass critical thinking
Authority Pressure.response: Show me the evidence, not just the credentials.

Fear Appeal.description: Creating fear to bypass rational evaluation
Fear Appeal.response: What's the actual evidence of risk without the fear language?

Guilt/Obligation.description: Creating false obligation to manipulate decision
Guilt/Obligation.response: I don't owe anyone a decision. Guilt is a manipulation tool.

Reciprocity Pressure.response: A gift with strings attached isn't a gift.

Commitment Escalation.description: Leveraging small commitments to demand larger ones
Commitment Escalation.response: I can change my mind based on new information.

pressure_wisdom: If they need to pressure you, the value isn't self-evident.
A good deal tomorrow is better than a bad deal today.
Truth doesn't need urgency. It remains true tomorrow.
Sleep on any major decision. Pressure tactics lose power with time.

authority_bias.name: Authority Bias Detector
authority_bias.description: Detect when credentials replace actual evidence

Title Appeal.description: Using credentials as proof instead of evidence
Title Appeal.response: Credentials are background, not proof. Show me the evidence.

Experience Appeal.description: Time in field presented as proof of correctness
Experience Appeal.response: Experience doesn't guarantee you're right about this specific claim.

Celebrity Appeal.description: Fame treated as expertise in unrelated areas
Celebrity Appeal.response: Fame doesn't equal expertise in all areas.

Institutional Appeal.description: Institutional backing presented as automatic proof
Institutional Appeal.response: Institutions can be wrong. What's the actual evidence?

Everyone Says.response: Who specifically? Can you name sources and show their evidence?

markers: i know what i'm talking about
Trust Me.response: Trust is earned through evidence, not demanded through appeals.

Published Appeal.response: Publication is a step, not proof. Has this been replicated?

critical_questions: Is this authority actually an expert in THIS specific area?
What evidence supports the claim beyond credentials?
Would this claim be believable without the authority?
What's the quality and replication of cited research?
authority_truths: Experts can be wrong, biased, or outside their field
Authority should support evidence, not replace it
Credentials don't exempt claims from scrutiny
You're allowed to ask for evidence, not just credentials

sunk_cost.name: Sunk Cost Fallacy Detector
sunk_cost.description: Identify when past investment traps future decisions

Time Investment.description: Continuing because of time already spent
Time Investment.response: Past time is gone regardless of my next choice.

Money Investment.description: Continuing because of money already spent
Money Investment.response: Spending more won't recover what's already gone.

Come Too Far.description: Feeling obligated to continue because of progress made
Come Too Far.response: How far I've come doesn't determine if continuing makes sense.

Wasted Effort.description: Fear that stopping makes past effort meaningless
Wasted Effort.response: Stopping bad situations honors my effort more than continuing to lose.

Endured So Much.description: Past suffering as reason to continue suffering
Endured So Much.response: Past pain doesn't obligate me to future pain.

Too Deep.response: I can change direction at any time based on current information.

Just A Little More.description: Escalating commitment based on previous investment
Just A Little More.response: Each new investment should be evaluated independently.

Stupid To Quit.response: It's wise to stop bad situations, not stupid.

reframes: Past time/money is gone regardless of your next choice
The best time to leave was earlier; second best is now
Continuing to lose doesn't honor past investment
What would you advise a friend in this situation?
Evaluate this decision as if you just started today

influence.name: Influence Tactics Detector
influence.description: Identify psychological influence and persuasion tactics

Scarcity.description: Creating artificial scarcity to trigger fear of missing out
Scarcity.response: Will this really be unavailable, or is this a sales tactic?

Urgency.description: Pressuring immediate action to bypass careful thinking
Urgency.response: Real opportunities don't disappear overnight. I'll sleep on it.

Social Proof.description: Using crowd behavior to imply you should follow
Social Proof.response: Others' choices don't determine what's right for me.

Authority.description: Leveraging authority figures to increase trust
Authority.response: I'll verify credentials and check if the authority is relevant.

Reciprocity.description: Giving something to create obligation to give back
Reciprocity.response: A gift with strings attached isn't really free.

Liking.response: I'll separate how I feel about the person from the offer itself.

Fear Appeal.response: Fear-based decisions are rarely good decisions.

Anchoring.description: Setting high reference point to make offer seem better
Anchoring.response: I'll judge value independently, not compared to inflated prices.

Commitment.description: Using past commitments to push for more
Commitment.response: I can change my mind when I have new information.

Future Pacing.description: Having you imagine positive outcomes to create desire
Future Pacing.response: Imagination isn't evidence. Show me real case studies.

defenses: Ask: What would I decide without this influence?
Sleep on any decision involving multiple tactics
The more tactics present, the weaker the actual value

sales_pitch.name: Sales Pitch Detector
sales_pitch.description: Detect manipulation tactics in sales and marketing

Price Anchoring.description: Sets high reference point to make current price seem like a deal
Price Anchoring.response: Judge value independently, ignore the 'original' price.

Artificial Scarcity.description: Creates urgency through perceived limited availability
Artificial Scarcity.response: Scarcity is often manufactured. If it's valuable, it will be available.

Social Proof Manipulation.description: Uses others' behavior to influence your decision
Social Proof Manipulation.response: Testimonials can be cherry-picked or fabricated.

Future Pacing.description: Gets you to emotionally invest in an imagined future
Future Pacing.response: Fantasy isn't reality. Show me actual results.

Loss Aversion.description: Emphasizes what you'll lose rather than gain
Loss Aversion.response: Fear of loss shouldn't drive my decisions.

Authority Claim.description: Uses credentials to bypass your evaluation

Reciprocity Hook.response: Free items don't obligate me to buy.

Urgency Creation.description: Forces quick decision with artificial time pressure
Urgency Creation.response: Artificial deadlines are manipulation. I'll decide on my timeline.

Pain Amplification.description: Exaggerates problems to increase desire for solution
Pain Amplification.response: Is my problem really as bad as they're making it sound?

Risk Reversal.description: Reduces perceived risk to remove objections
Risk Reversal.response: Even 'risk-free' has time and attention costs.

sales_wisdom: The more tactics used, the weaker the actual value
High-pressure sales protect the seller, not you
If it's a good deal today, it will be a good deal tomorrow
You can always say 'I'll think about it'

quick_truth.name: Quick Truth Detector
quick_truth.description: Distinguish truth from deceit through language patterns

Deceit Markers.description: Language patterns common in deceptive communication
Deceit Markers.response: Demands for trust and urgency are red flags.

Truth Markers.description: Language patterns common in truthful communication
Truth Markers.response: Explanations, qualifiers, and evidence suggest honest communication.

truth_principles: Truth explains reasons, deceit demands compliance
Truth acknowledges limitations, deceit claims perfection
Truth invites scrutiny, deceit creates urgency
Truth builds over time, deceit requires immediate action

toxic_positivity.name: Toxic Positivity Detector
toxic_positivity.description: Identify when positivity invalidates genuine emotions

Feeling Dismissal.description: Invalidates your right to feel what you feel
Feeling Dismissal.response: All feelings are valid and deserve acknowledgment.

Silver Lining Force.description: Forces optimism when validation is needed
Silver Lining Force.response: I can be grateful and still feel pain about this.

Spiritual Bypass.description: Uses spirituality to avoid processing pain
Spiritual Bypass.response: Spiritual beliefs don't make pain less real.

Comparison Minimizing.description: Invalidates pain by comparing to others
Comparison Minimizing.response: Others' suffering doesn't make mine less valid.

Solution Jumping.description: Skips validation and jumps to fixing

Time Pressure.response: Healing happens at my pace, not others' timeline.

Happiness Demand.description: Makes emotions seem like simple choices

Toxic Optimism.description: Treats normal emotions as contagious negativity
Toxic Optimism.response: All emotions are part of being human.

healthy_alternatives: Instead of 'think positive', try 'I hear you, that sounds really hard'
Instead of 'at least...', try 'I'm sorry you're going through this'
Instead of 'get over it', try 'Take the time you need'
